alert.note: Alert for South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 29 at 1:36PM PST until December 29 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Wet snow expected, with total accumulations of 4 to 12 inches above 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County, including I-5 and Snowman Summit on Highway 89, and the communities of Mt. Shasta City, Dunsmuir, and McCloud. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be a break with much lighter snowfall from late Thursday morning through Thursday afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
